headline: Can HP’s Stock Rebound After a 21% Drop This Year?
summary: If you are wondering whether now is the right moment to buy, hold, or walk away from HP stock, you are not alone. Investors have watched HP bounce between cautious pessimism and bursts of optimism over the past year. After all, the stock closed most recently at $28.07, having dipped ever so slightly by 0.3% in the past week but pulled off a 5.1% gain across the last month. Despite those near-term gains, it is tough to ignore the fact that HP is still down 13.6% year-to-date and 21.2% over the...

headline: ELFA Names Deborah Baker of HP Inc. as 2026 Board Chair — Confirms New Slate of Officers and Directors
summary: MARCO ISLAND, Fla., Oct. 28, 2025 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- The Equipment Leasing & Finance Association (ELFA) today announced its new Board of Directors and Officers who will serve for the next 12 months, following the conclusion of the association’s 64th Annual Convention. Deborah Baker, VP, Global Payment Solutions, HP Inc., is the new ELFA Board Chair and Nathan Gibbons, CLFP, Chief Experience Officer, QuickFi, is now Chair-Elect. The Chair-Elect and new Board members were recommended by ELFA’s No

headline: Here's What to Expect From HP’s Next Earnings Report
summary: HP is gearing up to report its fiscal fourth-quarter results soon, and analysts anticipate a low single-digit decline in its earnings.

headline: HP (HPQ) Stock Downgraded by JPMorgan Amid PC Market Headwinds
summary: HP Inc. (NYSE:HPQ) is one of the AI Stocks Making Waves on Wall Street. On October 22, JPMorgan downgraded the stock to “Neutral” from Overweight with a $30 price target. According to the firm, HP is undergoing a rougher backdrop as it moves past the most favorable part of the PC volume and cost cycle. Analyst Samik […]

headline: The Zacks Analyst Blog Highlights Apple, Lenovo, Dell and HP
summary: Apple readies its Q4 results with gains in iPhone, Services, and Mac sales, even as Lenovo, Dell, and HP show solid PC shipment growth.
